page.title: 02FARMING - PETWORTH RURAL NE
page.content: The biggest farm, Marshall's, is about 550 acres including the small outlying units it controls. It employs six men,three living in farm cottages and three outside workers. Lowfold Farm is 400 acres, Linfold 140, Gownfold 120, (worked by the farmer and his son) Buckfold 60, worked by the farmer only, Bulchins only 15 acres. Crops are winter wheat, barley or oats. Lowfold make 2,000 tons of silage. Gownfold has half pasture, half cerials, and Buckfold grows corn only for the stock, and potatoes to sell at the farm gate. Horses are no longer used and the combine harvester, based on Marshall's Farm, is borrowed by the others as needed. In one well-to-do house the mother was ironing shirts for her son who had parted from his girl friend and brought his washing home. Domestic help is hard to find.
